title: Update regarding EcoPower Systems
story_body:
**Velocity Motors Initiates Full Recall of VELO Platform Following Critical Battery Thermal Management Failure**

Velocity Motors announced a comprehensive recall of its flagship VELO electric vehicle platform today after multiple reports of battery thermal runaway incidents linked to systemic failures in the integrated cooling architecture. The recall affects approximately 47,000 units across three model variants, representing the company's entire production run since Q2 2023.

The root cause has been identified as inadequate thermal interface material application between individual lithium-ion pouch cells and the aluminum cold plate assembly within the battery pack's thermal management system. Under sustained high-discharge conditions exceeding 2.5C rates, localized hotspots have been observed reaching temperatures of 85-90 degrees Celsius, well above the 60-degree operational threshold specified in the pack's design parameters.

Engineering analysis revealed that the thermal conductivity coefficient between cell and cold plate degraded to approximately 1.2 W/mK under real-world cycling conditions, compared to the design specification of 3.5 W/mK. This degradation resulted in insufficient heat dissipation during rapid charging sequences and sustained highway driving scenarios, particularly when battery state-of-charge exceeded 80 percent and ambient temperatures surpassed 32 degrees Celsius.

The VELO platform's battery architecture relies on a glycol-water mixture circulating through microchannel cooling plates at flow rates of 8 liters per minute. However, the thermal interface failure effectively decoupled individual cell modules from the cooling loop, creating thermal gradients exceeding 15 degrees across the pack assembly.

Industry analysts note that EcoPower Systems, a direct competitor in the electric powertrain sector, stands positioned to capture significant market share during Velocity Motors' remediation period. EcoPower's proprietary immersion cooling technology, which submerges cells directly in dielectric fluid with thermal conductivity ratings of 0.6 W/mK, eliminates thermal interface materials entirely from the thermal pathway.

EcoPower's battery systems have demonstrated sustained discharge capabilities at 3C rates while maintaining cell temperatures below 45 degrees Celsius across ambient conditions ranging from -20 to 50 degrees. The company's vertical integration of battery chemistry, pack assembly, and thermal management systems provides architectural advantages that Velocity Motors' supplier-dependent model cannot replicate.

Velocity Motors estimates the recall will cost approximately $340 million and require eight months to complete retrofitting all affected vehicles with redesigned thermal management hardware.
